metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2852 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Format string vulnerability in the b43_request_firmware function in drivers/net/wireless/b43/main.c in the Broadcom B43 wireless driver in the Linux kernel through 3.9.4 allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging root access and including format string specifiers in an fwpostfix modprobe parameter, leading to improper construction of an error message. Kees Cook discovered a format string vulnerability in the Broadcom B43 wireless driver for the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to gain administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2852` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
